benchmark_details.name: OAKINK2
benchmark_details.overview: OAKINK2 is a dataset of bimanual object manipulation tasks for complex daily activities. It introduces a structured representation for complex tasks, organizing them into three levels of abstraction: Affordance, Primitive Task, and Complex Task. The dataset provides multi-view image streams, 3D-pose annotations for human manipulation processes, and task specifications.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a dataset for studying bimanual object manipulation in complex task completion using structured task representations and multimodal observation.

data.source: Collected from real-world human interventions in various manipulation scenarios.
data.size: 4.01M frames across 627 sequences, including 264 complex task sequences.
data.format: videos and pose data with annotations
data.annotation: 3D motion, including pose and shape for the human upper-body, hands, and interacting objects.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are computed based on the comparison between predicted and ground truth motions with respect to trajectory accuracy and contact quality.
methodology.interpretation: High values of CR and low values of SIV are desirable, indicating effective hand-object interaction without penetration during manipulation.
methodology.validation: Cross-dataset validation with existing hand-object interaction datasets.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Ensured through careful annotation processes and compliance with ethical data collection practices.
